comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: The Manly ferry is the SS South Steyne in wartime drab livery of dull green (she has no white trim around the top of the bow). Manly ferries had this livery from 1942 to 1947 until refits returned them to their regular colours. The car is also in wartime livery, and that hideous Circular Quay Railway Station is yet to be blight the scene.
